reviewText: Just discovered Mercy, and am half way through the season ... what a great surprise !!This show is fresh and funny and sad and all the things that you would want from a great show.Probably the freshest take on a hospital drama in years - the full deal -- scripts, acting, stories ... such a pity it only lasted one season.

reviewText: I swear this is the inspiration for Nurse Jackie on Showtime (which is for adults only). The cast is really good and writing is quite good. A definite bargain on Amazon.

reviewText: Some good characters and interesting interactions among them. My main problem with the series (and perhaps why it was canceled) was that there were too many personal issues going on and not enough medical. More "ER" and less "General Hospital" would have made it better.

reviewText: Another fantastic series cancelled! I love the series that takes place in NJ. I am disappointed there was not a conclusion. The final episode leaves you hanging. But other than that it is really entertaining.

reviewText: I was so happy to see this here, I've been looking for it for a while, loved the show and hated that it was cancelled, started watching it and missed a few episodes but now I can watch the entire series at my leisure!! Not sure why it was cancelled but it had good potential if you ask me, I mean there were worse shows but I was hoping that it'd last. I'm loving it!! Just watched the first episode and it's wonderful quality no skips or scratched disc NOTHING!! Great show if you like ER I'd recommend this also~

reviewText: another er clone !!!. this one concerns the private and "professional" lives of three nurses (it would seem the hospital only has three nurses.) these nurses not only get personally involved with patients(how professional!!!) but seem to be even more medically knowledgeable than the doctors. most of the time they give medical advice to doctors concerning patients . (how moronic and rediculious). i guess the doctors in this hospital are all morons and not as medically informed as  doctors realistically are. so the bottom line about this series is idiot doctors and brilliant nurses. what a croc of s@#$!!!.

reviewText: I ordered several Dvd's of telivision shows that never made it past season one, and that I had never seen. This one I really enjoyed watching. You get to know the characters, and it's so nice to watch episodes back to back with no comercials. The only downfall is you end up wishing the story would continue when it ends. It was still well worth watching. I would recomend this dvd. Especially to anyone in the medical field.

reviewText: So I stumbled upon this show as well as Trauma on Netflix.  It's not a bad show, but was a bit slow at times.  I was kind of hoping for more action in this show especially after watching Trauma and with it being a medical show.  Favorite episode would really have to be the last episode but then I'm also mad at it since they cancelled it and now I'm left wondering WTH happened to Mike and Dr Sands!

reviewText: The 'powers that be' who decide what stays on TV amaze me.  'Mercy' was a great show; good storyline, believable characters, true-to-life.  I watched it on Comcast not realizing there was only 1 season.  There are so few shows on TV now that are worth watching. The 'reality' thing has gotten completely out of hand as well as the 'dance' shows.  I am hoping another network will pick up this gem.  Maybe USA or TNT ?
summary: Great show. I can't believe it was cancelled

reviewText: Great series but unfortunately they cancelled it after one season. Seems they do that with the good shows...This series is about a nurse home from a tour in Iraq...I am a nurse and work with soldiers and the series attempted to portray the demons faced by retuning Veterans. My daughter and I both enjoyed the series...just wish there was a second season!
summary: Mercy....wish there was more than one season to this show!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I loved this show. Law & Order's demise is the fault of NBC execs & Leno vs Conan, NOT Mercy.Screw NBC for pulling a show with such an intense cliff-hanger of a season-not-series finale.If I were to get the next episode (the never to be aired episode of the non-existent season two), I would snap this up in a New Jersey heartbeat.Michelle Trachtenberg was terrific in this show, her best work ever. Taylor Schilling, the beautiful Jamie Lee Kirchner, James van der Beek, KELLY BISHOP -- great job playing a rich lady with ALS...Mary Stuart Masterson...the casting was superb all around.
summary: Haven't seen DVD but LOVED the show

reviewText: I love the series which I only seen on dvd. The writing was very good and the characters loveable as they combat series medical issues as well as Life issues. The Big disappointment was that it ended with sort of a cliffhanger. I enjoyed it a lot . The writing, acting and production values were all great. If you like medical dramas sprinkled with enough humor to make it  a pretty fun trip.
summary: Mercy : One Season was not enough cause its great.
